This week's puzzle involves brand names of foods at the grocery.
If I asked you to take Dole D-O-L-E, as in pineapples, and rearrange the letters to name an ore deposit, you would say lode L-O-D-E.
So, what anagrams do each of the following names conceal?
And your first one is Goya G-O-Y-A, as in beans and Hispanic foods, and your clue is means of meditation.
Number two is Nestea N-E-S-T-E-A; a legislative body.
Ore-Ida, as in the potato-based frozen foods, and your clue is one carrying equipment at a rock concert.
Perdue, as in the chicken; put through a blender.
Folgers, and your clue is certain sportsmen.
Yoplait Y-O-P-L-A-I-T, as in the yogurt; what a child puts sand in at the beach.
How about Wheaties, as in the breakfast cereal; and your clue is body of water in northwest Russia.
